title: Software Architect (m/f/x)
body:
AT, Dornbirn

Tridonic, the Zumtobel Group's technology company, is a leading global player in the field of lighting technology that produces innovative hardware and software for smart and connected lighting systems.

Your job

CONNECT SYSTEMS AND SOFTWARE – DEVELOP THE ARCHITECTURE
Our Global System Architecture team at our headquarters in Dornbirn develops the system and software architecture of state-of-the-art lighting management and IoT systems.

You create the software architecture for our lighting management and IoT systems at our headquarters in Dornbirn.
 

  • #analyse & understand: You analyse the diverse requirements of our software products (functionality, quality, security, etc.) and define specifications for the various stakeholders.
  • #architecture: You conceptualize and design the software architecture and you are responsible to communicate and coordinate your concept with the development team.
  • #development: You help software developers with the implementation of the software architecture.
  • #optimization: You evaluate, test and implement new technologies and tools for best-in-class software.

Your profile

You combine comprehensive programming and architecture know-how with a winning, communicative personality.
 

  • You have a higher education (FH, TU) in computer science or something comparable.
  • You are an experienced architect with a high level of expertise in programming, developing and designing software architectures with Java and Linux/Windows – additional knowledge in the areas of cloud services and IoT would be an advantage.
  • Your assertiveness and perseverance help you to focus on architecture
  • You are capable of translating and clarifying technical applications to stakeholders without technical background and working in an agile project environment.
  • Your calm and positive personality helps you to cooperate with an interdisciplinary global team.

We offer

Enlightening your career
We curiously discover new fields of work together, our mentoring program is meant to support you to fully develop your skills and potentials.

International perspective
Be part of a network of creativity and high-tech and contribute to an ecosystem that enables you to realize your potential within multinational, intercultural teams.

Work-Life-Balance
Your best individual work-life balance will vary over time, often on a daily basis, this is why we offer flexible working-models and sabbatical options for our employees.

Open-minded and respectful culture
Working for the ZG means to be a part of an open-minded and passionate culture based on the spirit of the company’s founder Dr. Walter Zumtobel.

Legally binding note: Based on the minimum salary (at 38.5 hours per week) of € 52,369.-/p.a. as stipulated in the collective agreement, the actual salary for this position is based on professional qualifications and experience.

Contact

That sounds like an attractive task for you? We are looking forward to receiving your application!
